title: Machine Learning-Based Magnesium Alloy Reverse Engineering Project

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations in materials science, introduction to machine learning, basic concepts of alloy design
context.additional_context: Strengthening competency in designing low-cost, high-performance magnesium alloys applicable to practical tasks

learning_goals: Optimization of artificial neural network inputs using the PSO algorithm can derive alloy compositions and process parameters that meet target performance criteria
A low-cost magnesium alloy design can be executed by applying an RMLDM model featuring five alloying elements and three extrusion process variables
The reliability of the design model can be evaluated by analyzing ANN prediction accuracy (>94%) based on experimental validation data

resources: PSO (Particle Swarm Optimization) algorithm implementation tool

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
